page.title: 14MORGAN TOWER, DUNDEE
page.content: { Morgan Tower}was built by{Samuel Bell in 1794.Tradition has it that the oriental features were at the request of its original sea captain owner, Morgan.The thickness of the walls, the survival of huge blocks of red sandstone at the rear,the survival of the well and a peculiar U-Shaped building behind the adjacent terrace, together with an early legend that Morgan converted rather than built his own tower and the knowledge that this corner of Dundee was at the far western extremity within the town of 1548,all lead to the possibility that the history of this corner may be more interesting than the accepted dating of the late 18th century suggests. A{five-storey bow}projects into the pavement; it has{Venetian windows, a {Saracen's hat roof}and a{Muslim moon as a weathervane.
